alert.note: Alert for Craig; Montgomery; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:19PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Roanoke, south central Craig and northeastern Montgomery Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 717 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mc Donalds Mill, or near Shawsville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph and pea size hail. Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain may wash debris onto the highway with poor drainage flooding along driveways and culvert pipes. Locations impacted include... Sinking Creek... Mc Donalds Mill... Elliston-Lafayette... Bradshaw... and Elliston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building or vehicle. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
